message.content:
Several tourist attractions in Mexico City include:

1. Museo Nacional de Antropología (National Museum of Anthropology): One of the largest and most extensive anthropology museums in the world, housing a vast collection of pre-Hispanic artifacts and artworks from different Mexican cultural regions.

2. Palacio de Bellas Artes (Palace of Fine Arts): A grand marble building that serves as an opera house, concert hall, and art gallery featuring murals by famous Mexican artists like Diego Rivera.

3. Zócalo / Plaza de la Constitución: The heart of Mexico City is its central square/zocalo – one of the largest city squares in the world – surrounded by historic buildings like Metropolitan Cathedral, National Palace, Old Portal de Mercaderes.

4. Catedral Metropolitana (Metropolitan Cathedral): Built over three centuries between 1573-1813 on top of a sacred Aztec site -Templo Mayor-, this impressive structure combines Gothic, Baroque and Neoclassical architectural styles.

5. Templo Mayor & Zona Arqueológica: An important archaeological site that was once part of the main temple complex for Aztecs; visitors can explore its museum which holds several ancient Mexican artifacts including giant stone carvings representing gods Huitzilopochtli and Tlaloc

6. Bosque de Chapultepec (Chapultepec Park): One of Latin America's largest urban parks covering over 1600 acres with two lakes; home to Chapultepec Zoo, children’s amusement park La Feria, multiple gardens & more museums along Paseo Reforma Avenue

7. Frida Kahlo Museum ("La Casa Azul"): Located in Coyo
